CHAPTER 8-9
ADULT USES - PERFORMER RESTRICTIONS AND REQUIREMENTS
8-9-1
DANCING
All dancing at any Adult Use establishment shall occur on a platform intended for that
purpose which is raised at least two (2) feet from the level of the floor.  No dancing shall
occur closer than six (6) feet to any patron.  No dancer shall have any physical contact with
any patron and no patron shall have any physical contact with any dancer while the dancer
is engaged in a performance of live sexually oriented entertainment.  Specific anatomical
areas as defined in 16-1-1 shall not be exhibited during any dance.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 434, 2/17/09.
SDCL 11-12-4 & 11-12-5
SDCL 12
8-9-2
GRATUITIES
No patron shall directly pay or give any gratuity to any dancer and no dancer shall solicit
any pay or gratuity from any patron.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 434, 2/17/09.
SDCL 11-12-4 & 11-12-5
SDCL 12
8-9-3
ESTABLISHMENT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS
No later than March 1 of each year any Adult Use establishment at which any live dancers
have performed shall file a verified report with the City showing the licensee's gross
receipts and amounts paid to dancers for the preceding calendar year.  In addition, any
such establishment shall maintain and retain for a period of two (2) years the names,
addresses, and ages of all persons the licensee employed as dancers and all persons the
licensee retained as independent contractors to dance.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 434, 2/17/09.
SDCL 11-12-4 & 11-12-5
SDCL 12
8-9-4
INDECENT EXPOSURE DURING SALE OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
A.
It is unlawful for any person on premises licensed for the sale of alcoholic
beverages, while in the presence of any other person, to expose specified
anatomical areas as defined in 16-1-1.  
B.
It is unlawful for any licensee in alcoholic beverages to cause, allow or permit any
person on the licensed premises to violate the provisions of subsection (A) of this
section.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 434, 2/17/09.
